intro: Mollinedia ligustrina var. friburgensis, commonly known as the Friburgensis Mollinedia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with cool climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
